name: Cybersecurity Maturity Model Certification 2.0
overview: Cybersecurity Maturity Model Certification 2.0 - DoD contractor cybersecurity requirements. Focus on Level 2 (110 practices) for most contractors handling Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI).

Access_Control.description: Access control and identity management requirements

AC.1.001.description: Limit information system access to authorized users, processes acting on behalf of authorized users, and devices
AC.1.001.examples: Zero-trust network access, Device compliance checking, Identity verification
AC.1.001.use_cases: Microsoft Entra ID, Cisco ISE, Palo Alto Networks Prisma Access

AC.2.007.description: Employ the principle of least privilege, including for specific security functions and privileged accounts
AC.2.007.examples: Privileged access management, Just-in-time access, Role-based access control

SC.1.175.description: Employ cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure of CUI during transmission
SC.1.175.examples: Data encryption in transit, Secure communications, TLS/SSL implementation
SC.1.175.use_cases: Microsoft BitLocker, AWS KMS, Thales CipherTrust

System_Information_Integrity.description: System and information integrity monitoring requirements

SI.2.216.description: Monitor organizational systems, including inbound and outbound communications traffic
SI.2.216.examples: Network monitoring, Threat detection, Traffic analysis

IR.2.092.description: Establish an operational incident-handling capability for organizational systems
IR.2.092.examples: Incident response automation, CUI breach handling, Response procedures
IR.2.092.use_cases: ServiceNow Security Operations, IBM Resilient, Microsoft Defender for Cloud
